fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying a third party macro and pasting on the same blog results in the pasted macro to be seen as a single blue line only. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a 3rd party macro on page
# Copy the macro
# Paste the macro in the same page

h3. Expected Results
The pasted macro is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The pasted macro looks like a blue line but can still be selected.

h3. Notes
* It can be selected and edited but the updated values do not reflect upon publishing (save/publish behavior similar to CONFCLOUD-62749). 
* After publishing the page, selecting edit now shows the previously pasted macro.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting of 3rd party macro is not working in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting Confluence space leaves behind data causing imports of the same space key to fail

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take backup of existing Confluence space
# Delete the Confluence space after generating a backup of it
# Import Confluence space

h3. Expected Results

Confluence space import completes successfully

h3. Actual Results

UI shows the following message:

bq. A space with key ___ already exists.


h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support to run the SQL queries on the following page to delete all traces of the space key:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/after-a-failed-space-import-it-s-not-possible-to-re-import-because-of-leftover-space-data-217743668.html
fields.summary: Deleting Confluence space leaves behind data causing imports of the same space key to fail

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Description
With the [recent editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], Confluence no longer supports Markup/the Markup macro on the new editor. 

As this can be an essential feature for Confluence users, this is a suggestion to have the Markup macro compatible/enabled for the new editor as this was with the legacy editor.
fields.summary: Support Wiki Markup for the new editor

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to create indented action lists
h3. Why is it important

Creating sub-actions are useful to organize bigger tasks that are broken into smaller steps
h3. Suggested solution

Have a similar solution as what was found in the Legacy Editor / Server editor

 

From CONFCLOUD-59780:
h3. Expected Results

The list should be indented as image below:
 !_thumb_315285.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The list is not indented, as you can see below:
   !current.png|thumbnail!

From CONFCLOUD-65814:
h3. Expected Results

The copying example:
 * The paragraph should come with the same indentation than the source

The manual example:
 * Hitting *TAB* should get only the first line indented.

h3. Actual Results

The copying example:
 * The paragraph comes with a Confluence default indentation.

The manual example:
 * Hitting *TAB* gets all the paragraph indented.
fields.summary: Create indented action lists

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Summary
When using the Column Macro, it is impossible to resize (change width) of tables and images. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page in Fabric Editor
# Add Column Macro
# Add table or image in a column

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to resize and manipulate tables and images just as if columns were not used.

h3. Actual Results
The user cannot resize or manipulate tables or images.

h3. Workaround
- Drag-and-drop or copy the table or image to a portion of the page where you do not use columns, then resize table/image, before moving the table/image back to its column.
fields.summary: Ability to resize images within table cells or layout columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
MS Office (Word/Excel/ Powerpoint)Macros don't see files attached to the page.

h3. Environment
Both TinyMCE and Fabric


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an Office file to a Pages
# Select the appropriate macro.
# Try to select the file when prompted.


h3. Expected Results
You should be able to see a list of all relevant attachments.

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown list is empty.  401/403 errors can be observed in the Developer Tools Console.

h3. Workaround
The embedded view/preview still works.
fields.summary: Excel/Word/PPT Macro throws 401/403 errors when trying to fetch the relevant attachments on a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Column Macro and you exceed a certain height limit (more than 25 lines), the toggle icon will disappear and you cannot change the column width. 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page in Fabric Editor
# Add Column Macro (by default they will be full page width)
# The height of the column should be more than 25 lines
# Toggle the icon to change the column width

h3. Expected Results
The user can still change (cycle through) column width options.

h3. Actual Results
The column width toggle icon will be missing if its column height exceeds around 25 lines. 

h3.Workaround
- Revert to previously published version and manually re-do any other changes to content.
fields.summary: Column width toggle icon is missing

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * An existing page which used panel macro
 * The page is migrated to the new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the edit page
 # Click the frame of the panel and click the pencil icon at the button

h3. Expected Results

User is able to adjust the settings they did in the old editor
h3. Actual Results

The following window is shown and there are no options are shown to change the settings

!スクリーンショット 2019-03-05 14.33.57.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Unable to change the titles of the migrated panel macros

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* An existing page which used panel macro that have an image inside
* The page is migrated to the new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the page

h3. Expected Results
The thumbnail of the image is shown

h3. Actual Results
The image is shown in a grey icon.
 !スクリーンショット 2019-03-05 14.27.58.png|thumbnail! 

Thumbnail is shown as expected in the edit page.
 !スクリーンショット 2019-03-05 14.27.28.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Remove the panel or move the image from the panel
fields.summary: Image thumbnail is not shown in a panel macro migrated from the old editor

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the old editor, it was possible to add external images to a page using the URL of the image.

 !Screenshot 2019-10-10 at 15.16.11.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggestion
It appears that this function has been deprecated in the new editor. It would be great to have that back.

h4. Workaround
Right-click the external image and select *Copy Image*
Paste the image into the page.
fields.summary: Ability to add Images from web in the new editor
Using <ri:user ri:accountId="account-id"/> while calling /wiki/rest/api/content/ID returns 500

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At this point in time, cac is down. I have an automated job which requests https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179443532/bamboo_regex_v2.xml -- Confluence displays an error page but with a 200 status. I would expect a 503 status.
h3. Environment
cac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # request https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179443532/bamboo_regex_v2.xml when cac is returning a "Something went wrong. We're moving mountains to get it sorted." page.
 # Check the http status

h3. Expected Results
A 503 status
h3. Actual Results
A 200 status

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Requesting an attachment when a server is down returns a 200 response

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if you create a new page, and publish it, then edit the page, and publish it again (and so on…..) every time you open the editor and publishes the page, the memory allocation of the tab increases significantly, and does not goes back.

h3. Environment
- New Editor
- Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Open Chrome's Task Manager
# Publish the page
# Edit the page again
# Publish the page and check the Task Manager

h3. Expected Results
Memory Allocation should either stall or have not very significant changes in allocation.

h3. Actual Results
You can get to 1GB of memory allocated to a single tab by publishing a page from 4 to 5 times.

h3. Workaround
Manually reload the page to refresh the allocation.
fields.summary: Too much memory consumption on page publish in the new editor

fields.description:
[Your bug reporting mechanism is _*broken*_:  I tried two browsers and in each case trying to enter a bug report (as opposed to a "Suggestion") dumped me either into the HipChat Jira or into a loop.  As a result, I'm entering this report as a "Suggestion"...I would appreciate it if you could correct it, as well as your bug reporting mechanism.]

In both the on-site page history as well as the e-mail notification, when the change is made to an entry in a table, the difference shows the table row with the original text in the changed entry red-lined, and _the adjoining entry_ _also redlined_, and the replacement text is shown as being applied to the adjoining entry; it also shows an new (empty) cell inserted to the right of the adjoining entry, with all other table entries shifted to the right.

This affects only the difference display; the published page displays correctly.

 

(FWIW, our Confluence installation claims to be version 1000.0.0-66d80941701.)
fields.summary: Page history comparison displays incorrect difference for changes to table cell

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When any word document is imported in Confluence, it is not visible in the left sidebar page tree.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Fabric Editor
 * Tiny MCE editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import any word document in any space.
 # Check for the imported space in the left sidebar page hierarchy.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be there in the left page tree.
h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't show up in the page tree.
h3. Notes
 - You can see the page in the reorder pages section.
 - It is not affecting all Word documents imported to a site

h3. Workaround

After completing the import, proceed with the below:
 # Go to *Space Settings > Content Tools > Reorder Pages*;
 # Expand the page tree;
 # Find the page and drag it out from the homepage;
 # Drag it to under the homepage again.

This way, the page will be shown in the page tree as it should.

Alternatively, you can rename the page and it will be shown in the page tree after publish.
fields.summary: Imported word document doesn't show up in the page tree in left sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary In fabric editor when the smart card is used for a link, the page cannot be edited or copied when href="URL" is missing from the smart card storage format. h3. Environment * Fabric editor * Confluence Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page in fabric editor with smart cards. # Remove the below-highlighted portion by updating the bodycontent from database :

[https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/NAG/pages/410648650/Label+test]

h3. Expected Results The page should be editable h3. Actual Results The page breaks and cannot be copied or edited. The below exception is thrown in the console logs: {noformat} react-dom.production.min.js:198 Error: @atlaskit/smart-card: url property is missing. at e.render (render.js:27) at Pi (react-dom.production.min.js:173) at Ci (react-dom.production.min.js:172) at zi (react-dom.production.min.js:180) at qa (react-dom.production.min.js:232) at Ha (react-dom.production.min.js:233) at Pl (react-dom.production.min.js:249) at _l (react-dom.production.min.js:248) at kl (react-dom.production.min.js:245) at Xa (react-dom.production.min.js:243) {noformat} h3. Notes The broken page will contain a portion with "[inlineCard]" h3. Workaround No workaround, updating database with the href does not allow the page to be editable.
fields.summary: Cannot edit the page when smart card has href=url portion missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Safari, Confluence seems to be truncating part of the text, in the editor and published mode.

h3. Environment
* Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Enter a few paragraphs.

h3. Expected Results
Full text is displayed

h3. Actual Results
Text gets truncated, only in Safari. 

h3.Workaround
Use another browser. i.e Firefox or Chrome
fields.summary: Confluence text gets truncated on Safari

fields.description:

h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)

* Chrome, Version 66.0.3359.139 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 * Mac Mojave, 10.14.3 (18D42)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

fields.summary: Checkbox disappear after clicking

fields.description:
h3. The issue
If you change the Macro's details to be *Hidden*, once published the page still displays the Macro's content.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a new page
# Add a *Page Properties* Macro and insert a column with some data
# Check the *Hidden* field on the macros options
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Behavior
The page would be published and the content from the macro would not show up

h3. Actual Behavior
The content shows up once the page is published

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Hide Page Properties Macro not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you create a page property report macro in a page, and change the *Title* column to something else, on Preview the change is applied, although once published, the page does not display the *Heading* with the name you've chosen.

h3. Environment
New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some pages with *Page Properties*
 # Create a new page, and add a *Page Property Report Macro*
# On the *Macro edit panel*, in *Options* click *Show*
# Type anything you want under *Title column heading* and refresh the preview

h3. Expected Results
Once published, the page would match what you see on the Preview

h3. Actual Results
The component is not updated to reflect what you've chosen.

h3. Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Changes to Heading Title in Page Property Reports not being applied

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Blog Posts" Macro is not correctly rendering blog posts images, profile pictures and it is removing any formatting that the image may have. 
h3. Environment
* Blog posts are correctly displayed if viewed directly on "Blog" section of a space, this issue arises when blog posts (that contain images) are viewed through a page using the "Blog Posts" Macro. The images on the blog post lose their formatting, and are displayed as if they had no fortmatting whatsoever


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post with an image - I added an image with the "Wrap Right" formatting.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-01 at 14.33.29.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the Blog post - everything is fine so far...
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-01 at 14.34.36.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a page and add the "Blog Posts" Macro (on this macro "Content Type to Display" leave the selection as 'entire') > Publish the page;
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-01 at 14.37.42.png|thumbnail! 
# Check the recently published page, containing the blog posts.

h3. Expected Results
* Blog Posts (and their images) to be displayed exactly like they were appear on "Blog" section, without any changes to the image formatting

h3. Actual Results
* Images lose their formatting, being displayed as if they have no formatting (even though they are correctly rendered the blog post itself).
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-01 at 14.52.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes :
This behavior is present either on the old and new editor alike


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Blog Posts" Macro Does not render images correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attached Files are not displaying previews/thumbnails.

h3. Environment
* Confluence new editing experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a PDF or PPTX file as attachment
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The file is displayed as a thumbnail

h3. Actual Results
The file is displaying as a grey box, with the filename in it.

h3. Notes
Word, vsd and vsdx files are also not showing thumbnails
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attached Files are not displaying previews/thumbnails.

fields.description:
In the old UI, the user was first deactivated and then deleted.

Now, once you click on remove user, it will delete the user from the site.

It is not clearly communicated to a few customers that removing a user will permanently delete the user from the site.
fields.summary: Remove User option In User management should clearly mention user will be deleted

fields.description:
Steps:
 # Create a page with random content on desktop
 # Select "..."
 # Select "Copy"
 # Page content is not copied to the newly created page.
fields.summary: Copy menu option does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the instance has the new navigation, it will ignore the homepage set on the "further configurations" and will open the all-updates page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an instance with the new navigation
# Set its homepage to be a space (Further configuration)
# Click on Confluence's logo

h3. Expected Results
It should redirect to the space's overview page

h3. Actual Results
It opens all-updates page.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence's homepage is not respected on the new navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the new editor of Confluence, when a user uses the [include page macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/include-page-macro-724765214.html] with specific content (tested with a date picker and a table) from other page using the new editor, the same will not convert the content properly and cause different issues like having the date picker colored, as reported in [this issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65700], which is a symptom from the Legacy editor and having an "Unsupported Content" once the page is published, if using a table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence make sure to create two pages: One for the content and other to use the *Include page macro*.
# On the first page, make sure to edit it and insert a date picker with a past day and insert a table.
# Once the page with the content to be included is published, go to the second page and insert the *Include page macro*

h3. Expected Results

The macro should render the content according to the new editor modification,

h3. Actual Results
The macro displays the content with older information or incompatible ones as the exempla below:

!include.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Use the *[Excerpt Include|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html]* with the [Excerpt macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-macro-724765191.html] in order to have the content shared between both pages.
fields.summary: Include Page macro with conversion issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Fabric editor

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Plain text macros are not supported in the new editor

fields.description: page properties report borders need the option of being solid
fields.summary: page properties report borders need the option of being solid

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot publish the changes when editing a page on the iPad.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor
Confluence App on iPad

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Fabric Editor
# Publish that page on a desktop
# Install Confluence app on iPad
# Sign in and open the same page 
# Edit that page on iPad
# Press "Publish" 

h3. Expected Results
- Should be able to publish changes on iPad. 

h3. Actual Results
Getting an error when publishing the changes:
{code}
Error "Validation failure when converting format"
{code}

or 
{code}
Forbidden
{code}

h3. Notes
* Works fine when using Confluence App on iOS phone.

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Unable to publish changes when using iPad in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a Calendar into Outlook, it does not show any events except for the Travel events

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Follow the guide on this KB: [Subscribing to Team Calendar from Outlook|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcalcloud/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook-909903961.html]

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  ->   !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
All events get added

h3. Actual Results
Only Travel events are shown

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Events do not get added to Outlook Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Space Setting is missing on the sidebar navigation for documentation theme spaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a documentation space 
 # Open Sidebar

h3. Expected Results

Space Setting visible
 !_thumb_3509679.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Space Setting Missing
 !_thumb_3509665.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Contact Support
fields.summary: Missing Space Settings from the side-bar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there's a long row with merged cells in the excel file, the macro will not properly render some of the cells.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a xlsx document with at least a long row with merged cells
 # Attach to a Confluence page
 # Insert an *Office Excel *Macro and point it to the file
 # Publish the page


h3. Expected Results
The file should be rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
Some cells are not correctly displayed :
| !excel_long_row.gif!  |

h3. Notes
It's possible to reproduce the issue with the following sample file:
 [^sample.xlsx] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excel macro issue on rendering long rows with merged cells

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Product Requirements page created from template loses its formatting in the new Editor
h3. Environment

When adding a 'Product requirements' page from template on an instance that is currently using the new editor, the page loses some of its formatting when published, (such as headers no longer being displayed in *bold*) as can be seen in the next screenshots
 * Formatting on the old editor - no issues with headers losing bold formatting
 ** viewing page In Edit Mode
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 16.13.05.png|thumbnail!
 ** published page
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 16.13.30.png|thumbnail!

 * Formatting on the new editor - headers losing bold formatting when comparing the page in Edit mode vs published
 ** viewing page In Edit Mode
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 16.13.51.png|thumbnail!
 ** published page
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 16.14.06.png|thumbnail!

Notice how the header of each line loses its bold formatting after the page has been published.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a 'Product Requirements' page using the 'Product requirements' blueprint
 # Compare the table formatting content inside the "Page properties" macro before publishing the page;
 # Publish the page and see that headers on the lines in the table have lost their bold formatting.

h3. Expected Results
 * Headers keep their bold formatting after the page has been published.

h3. Actual Results
 * Headers *lose* their bold formatting after the page has been published.

h3. Notes

This behavior is present on the new Confluence editor
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Product Requirements page created from template loses its formatting in the new Editor

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently, it is only possible to use *Vertical* fixed headers on Confluence Tables. It would be nice to have *Horizontal* Fixed headers as well for tables that have a large width.
fields.summary: Add Horizontal Fixed Headers in Confluence Tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, Confluence has a "[Default welcome message|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/editing-the-site-welcome-message-724765520.html]" in which can be customized to show different content while navigating on the dashboard. However, at the moment, the message is not being displayed, even if configured to be the default one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
Access Confluence's Activity dashboard (https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates).
 
h3. Expected Results

The message should be displayed on the right side of the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

The content is blank, not showing the message and no errors are triggered.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Welcome message not displaying on Confluence's dashboard

fields.description:
Currently, SVG content is not rendered within pages, thus attached SVG files do not generate thumbnails, cannot be previewed, and do not show up in exported pages.

As SVG is a preferred format for diagrams as well as logos and other graphics, implementing full support would be highly appreciated.
fields.summary: Implement SVG support  for thumbnails, previews and page exports.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When a comment is a pin on a PDF file which is stored in the comment, clicking on the navigation panel on the comment will force the pdf to close.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Embed a pdf file on the page comment.
 # Pin a few comments on the pdf file and select on the up/down arrow on the comment navigation panel.
 # Notice that the file crashed and force the PFD viewer to close. 

h3. *Expected Results*

The comment navigation panel should show the comments without closing the PDF viewer

h3. *Actual Results*

PDF viewer crashed

h3. *Notes*

This issue was noticed to be reproducible only for PDF file that saved in the page comment.
h3. *Developer tools logs:*
{code:java}
mediaviewer-2.js:1531 Deprecated API usage: page destroy method, use cleanup() instead

 {code}

h3. *Workaround*
 # None at the moment.
fields.summary: PDF viewer crashed when using comment navigation panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's no longer possible to add @ mentions to templates in Confluence Cloud

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a new template, try to add an @ mention, it's no longer an option.

h3. Expected Results
Ability to @ mention users in a template.

h3. Actual Results
@ mentions are no longer possible in a template.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 13.33.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No current workaround, besides copying an existing page.
fields.summary: @ Mentions are no longer possible in template editor

fields.description:
You can add a table to a page in Confluence, and whilst you can order by a column heading it would be useful to actually be able to filter the contents of the table.

For example, I use tables when recording questions back and forth and it would be useful to filter out the 'complete' records to only see what's still outstanding.
fields.summary: Allow table filtering in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In TinyMCE editor, dates are showing up as red or orange (past due or coming due) when not attached to a task

 

!Screen Shot 2019-02-27 at 11.37.57 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add a date macro to a page, selecting a date in the past, but do not attach it to a task.
h3. Expected Results

I would expect dates not attached to a task not to change color at all.
h3. Actual Results

You will see that the date turns red if it's in the past, and orange if it's coming up.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround.
fields.summary: Past and approaching dates are showing up red and orange (late) when not attached to a task in TinyMCE

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some users will hit into issues when editing Confluence page. The error you will see will be  the "Can't save changes" next to Publish button and message "Something went wrong after loading the editor" message.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a Confluence page that is already open (this does not happen to newly created pages)
 # Click on edit on the page 
 # The page will go into draft mode with URL like https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<space>/pages/edit/<id>?draftId=<id>&draftShareId=<random>
 # You will see the following message pop up "Something went wrong after loading the editor. Copy your unsaved changes and refresh the page to keep editing." on the top right of the screen.
 # You will also see the error message "Can't save changes" next to the "Publish" Button
 

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to save the page normally
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser debug log at console tab 
{noformat}
...Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (websocket closed) synchrony:17:23
warn {:message out-chan terminated remotely} log.cljc:24:59
Synchrony: Warning: Channel disconnected by server. Attempting to reconnect. synchrony:17:23
Synchrony: Warning: reconnect (websocket closed) ...
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

Cloning the page using the option "Copy" at the Page menu should allow edit of the cloned page moving forward. This will be based on the latest published version and not the draft version.
fields.summary: Opening a page on Confluence Editor does not allow edit or save

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the calendar is created by John, but John is not the first user to create an event he may not receive notifications for future events on that calendar of that event type. 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as John 
 # Create a team calendar
 # Login as another user eg Admin
 # Watch the calendar created in step 2
 # Login as Jane
 # Create a new event on the calendar in step 2
 # Admin will receive an email, but john will not

h3. Expected Results

John and admin should receive an email since they are both watching the calendar
h3. Actual Results

Only Admin received a notification of the new event
h3. Notes

When a new event is created a generic local "subcalendar" is created in TC_SUBCALS table 

If the first event is created by John a GenericLocalSubCalendarDataStore and InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore are created in TC_SUBCALS table.  However this doesn't seem to happen correctly when the first event is created by Jane.  

Uploaded a screencast here: 

[https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ouNyZyIewX70xSNYGMai7Sd79lFM4y0y]
h3. Workaround

I suppose it would be possible to export the calendar, delete it and then reimport it.
fields.summary: Team calendars may not send a notification to the calendar creator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user goes to the *Space Settings* and clicks on the *Edit* button to change the logo, nothing happens. Please see:
!Logo edit.gif!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Space Settings
 # Click on the button *Edit* next to the logo

h3. Expected Results
The user would see a pop-up to upload a new logo

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens
fields.summary: Unable to change Space logo
Bring back the "what's changed" comment box

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers unable to change Space logo or edit sidebar configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence space, go to *Space Settings* > *Sidebar Configuration*
# Click one of the toggles (Blog)

h3. Expected Results
* Blog would disappear from the sidebar

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens - neither are any entries logged in the browser's console.

h3. Workaround
Contact support and mention this bug ticket.
fields.summary: Unable to edit Sidebar Configuration

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, whenever you create a new page based on a template, you are no longer able to edit the template variables if you edit the page once again.

h3. The Suggestion
It would be good for users to be able to change the variables values after the initial save, in situations where the content is not to be completely filled out at publish, but rather during an entire week or month.
fields.summary: Allow users to change template variables after first save
Display JIRA Agile Kanban board on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Add a way to set the page's title to a "Sticky" state, as it scrolls along with the page. 

Currently, this is possible within Table's headers.
fields.summary: Sticky Page Title
'Table of Contents' macro loses its left alignment if placed within 'Columns' on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Linking to a version of a page loads the current published version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and publish it
 # Edit it, make some changes and publish it again, so you can have 2 versions of the same page
 # Go to *Page History*
 # Select the first version (v. 1)
 # Select its URL and copy it
 # Paste this URL to another page
 # Click the link

h3. Expected Results

You are redirected to the v. 1 of the linked page.
h3. Actual Results

You are redirected to the current published version.
h3. Workaround

Current there are no workarounds for the reported issue.
fields.summary: Linking to a version of a page loads the current published version

fields.description:
From CONFSERVER-52704:

??We use Confluence to maintain specifications.  The specifications are long, complicated and change often, the changes are driven by JIRA.  It is important to know when a part of a document has changed because of a specific issue and to be able to match changes with issues in the document history.  However, users make mistakes in the change comments or forget to fill them.  We would like to be able to modify a missing or wrong change information after the page has been modified.??

We need this functionality in Confluence Cloud as well.

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52704?focusedCommentId=1827095&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1827095

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52704?focusedCommentId=1837400&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1837400

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52704?focusedCommentId=1943371&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-1943371
fields.summary: Ability to edit page and attachment version change comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new editor, source page doesn’t have Incoming Links section and a user will be able to delete source page which is linked to a target page.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a source page (Page 1)
 # Create a target page (Page 2) and link source page (Page 1) on the target page.
 # In source page (Page 1) Page Information, *Incoming Links* section is not shown.
 # User deletes source page and the user will be shown that there are 0 incoming links while deleting the source page.
 # In the target page, clicking on source page (Page 1) link throws *Page Not Found* message.

h3. Expected Results

When a source page is deleted, a message should show that there are Outgoing links for this page.
h3. Actual Results

Source page shows 0 Incoming Links and user will be able to delete the source page.
h3. Notes
 * In the old editor, the source page information (Page 1) has Incoming Links section with details of the linked page (Page 2)
 * In the new editor, the target page information (Page 2) has an Outgoing Links section with details of the linked page (Page 1)

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incoming Links issue in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for a user in the Quick Filter in the new User Management, first 2 3 letter of the search string are not displayed and hitting the Enter button only, the whole search query is displayed. 

h3. Environment

Windows 10, Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Site-Administration > Users section.
# In the quick filter for users, start typing User Name  

h3. Expected Results

The whole Search String will be displayed, with the list matching the search string

h3. Actual Results

First few words on the Search String is not displayed. Screenshot Attached.

h3. Workaround

Use Firefox or Edge instead of Chrome.
fields.summary: First 3-4 characters are not visible in the quick filter of new User Management

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We have data into SQL server and we want to transfer that data into the salesforce.

How can I achieve this using confluence, Would you please guide me how can I defined source and mapped those field and run to enter data into the targetted place.

can please come back to me as soon as possible.

 

Thanks 

Kaniz Khot
fields.summary: Required to transfer data into salesforce
Include footer in HTML exports

fields.description:
* Go to space you don't watch
 * Click 'Add to spaces'
 * Go to dashboard via nav
 * Space isn't listed
 * After refresh, space shows

 
 * Go to space you watch
 * Click 'Remove from my spaces'
 * Go to dashboard via nav
 * Space is still listed on the side
 * After refresh, space is gone
fields.summary: "Remove from my spaces" + Global sidebar jank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*_m4a_* files not being recognized as appropriate attachments on the [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html].
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a *_.m4a_* file to your page;
 # Add a [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html] to your page;
 # Try to select the *_.m4a_* file.

h3. Expected Results

The *_.m4a_* files should be presented and selectable on the [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html].
h3. Actual Results

The [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/multimedia-macro-724765227.html] does not recognize *_.m4a_* files and a *No appropriate attachments* message displays on the File parameter.
h3. Workaround

Per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html] just drag and drop multimedia files into the editor.
fields.summary: .m4a files aren't recognized by Multimedia Macro

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, the Roadmap Macro is not displaying any text when the page is published, nor in the Editor. We can only see the text when editing the *Macro*

h3 Steps to replicate
Just add a Roadmap Macro to the page.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Roadmap Macro doesn't display text on Firefox or Edge

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary If you have a page hierarchy with link among the pages, and move this hierarchy to a different space, the links get broken due to the inclusion of the *old* space key. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Space (Space 1) # Now, create a page (Parent Page) # Now, create three child pages for the *Parent Page* (Child 1, Child 2, and Child 3) # Edit the *Parent Page* and include a link to each of the children (CMD/CTRL + K) # Publish the page # Now, create a new space (Space 2) # On the *Space 1*, move the *Parent Page* hierarchy (with the parent included), to Space 2 h3. Expected Results The links should still point to the right pages h3. Actual Results There is an addition to the page's Storage Format, which adds the *Space Key* to the links as follows: {code:html}


{code} The *old* version is as follows: {code:html}


{code} Since the link now points to *Space 1*, the link gets broken, because the page was moved to *Space 2*. h3. Workaround Manually edit the links to point to the right page.
fields.summary: Moving pages with links to a different space, breaks the links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Site Homepage" setting under 'Further Configuration' in Administration is used to set which page should load when clicking on the Confluence site logo in the top-left corner. Sometimes, when the user tries to go to the site homepage by clicking on the Confluence icon, it will reopen the last visited page instead of the Site Homepage. 

h3. Environment
Confluence CLoud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence's Site Homepage in Further Configuration to a specific space instead of the dashboard
# Click the site logo in the header, note that you're taken to the specified space's homepage.
# Go to 'Space Directory' or 'Activity' and then click on the site logo at the top-left corner.

h3. Expected Results
You're taken to the space/page specified in Further Configuration.

h3. Actual Results
You're taken to the last visited page

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Getting the last visited page instead of the Site Homepage

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently, there is no easy way for Administrators to export a list of pages and creators in Confluence Cloud. It would be nice to have a way to acquire this list.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to export a list of pages and creators on Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
This is a question, really. I have a number of global templates. When using them to create a new page, the new editing features are not available. Will these new editing capabilities be added to existing global templates? How will that work.

Thanks.

Linda
fields.summary: New Editing Features in Global Template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using the Chart Macro, for 3D bar chart especially, there's only an option for x and y axes, but not for a z-axis

Customers would like their bar chart to look like this:

!https://www.originlab.com/doc/en/UserGuide/images/3D_XYZ_Bar_with_Categorical_Text_XY/3D_XYZ_Bar_with_Categorical_Text_XY.png!

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to include an x-axis.

h3. Why this is important
Greater representation of data
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a chart with x-axis in Excel and embed it into the page.
fields.summary: Ability to add a z-axis in Chart Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Major issue that causes the analytics we capture to not represent activity with public facing Confluence Cloud instances. There aren't any workarounds, and the longer this issue remains, the more data we miss for our customers that we can't get back.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Install Connect Inspector (https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net/page/start)
# Allow Confluence to allow anonymous user access
# View a page as an anonymous user (not authenticated)
# Observe that no page_viewed webhook is fired
# Log in to Confluence and view a page
# Observe that a page_viewed webhook is fired

h3. Expected Results
Page views from anonymous users raise a webhook

h3. Actual Results
No page views are received, only when logged in.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Webhooks aren't received for anonymous user activity

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

HEIC images not rendered when uploaded through Confluence iOS app
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a page
 # Open the page via Confluence iOS app
 # Insert a .HEIC image using "Insert Image and Files"
 # Publish the page

h3. *Expected Results*

Image should render
h3. *Actual Results*

Image not rendering, showing as .HEIC file format:

!Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 9.46.48 AM.png|width=117,height=119!

*Workaround*
Disable the *Live Photo* functionality on the image you wish to share. Per Apple's website: [Edit Photos and Videos|https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/edit-photos-and-videos-iphb08064d57/ios]
# Open the Live Photo
# Click *Edit*
# Click the *Live Photo* button at the top of the screen in order to disable the Live Photo functionality. Save your changes.
# Now it will be possible to share the image to Confluence.

Alternative workaround:
 - Save the image on an external source and upload it from there
fields.summary: HEIC images not rendered when uploaded through Confluence iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

n/a
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Confluence Cloud instance
 # Go to ? > About Confluence
 # Observe the copyright date is 2017

h3. Expected Results

The copyright date is 2019
h3. Actual Results

(see screenshot)
h3. Notes

I do not know what component to use [~speachey]
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Visiting the About Confluence page shows a copyright of 2017

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when a user creates a Personal Space, it would have the username as the space key. When the [older username structure was used|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], creating a personal space would have its key as the username used and sometimes, the username could be the whole email for the user. When this user created the personal space, the key would use the "@" character and this makes the following message to be displayed when trying to access the *Overview* or *Blogs* page:

{quote}
(!) Page tree failed to load
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
No longer reproducible because the username structure has changed and this avoids specific characters to be used. Previously, when the usernames were using a different structure, if the user had its username as the whole email, simply creating a personal space would trigger this issue with the current page tree structure on the sidebar.

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar should render for the user, including its page tree.

h3. Actual Results
The page tree is not displayed and an error stating that the same failed to load would be displayed instead of the pages:

h3. Notes
* The "@" character is converted to *%40*. By manually putting the "@" character, the page tree will properly load.

h3.Workaround
Manually change the URL to use the "@" character, or, ask the user to move the pages to a different space, and then, delete and re-create the personal space so the pages can be moved again and the issue will not be presented due to the new username structure used, in which will be used as the space key.
fields.summary: Personal Space using "@" character does not load the page tree

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User mentions do not work when used inside the Page Template creation/edit

h3. Steps to reproduce
# To go *Settings > Global Template and Blueprints*
# Create a new one or edit an existing Page Template
# Try to use a user mention

h3. Expected results
Typing @ brings up the user search. Adding the User mention macro allows us to mention a user. 

h3. Actual results
The user search does not come up. The mention macro is broken.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 13.33.22.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 13.33.35.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-02-21 at 13.33.44.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User mention on Page Template creation does not work

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Before, it was possible to create a table by selecting the size of it as 3x4, or 5x5 etc... With the release of the new editor, we need to click on the *Plus* icons before doing so.

It would be nice to have this feature back into the new editor.
fields.summary: Bring back table cell's creator on new Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is no longer possible to edit the settings of the Task report macro in the Fabric Editor. This worked fine up until a few days ago, so it was just recently broken.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create page in Fabric Editor
# Insert Task Report macro
# Click/select macro on the page and click the Edit-icon (pen icon)

h3. Expected Result
A popup window where you can edit the settings of the Task report macro.

h3. Actual result
Nothing happens when clicking the Edit button (pen icon).

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Cannot edit settings of Task Report macro in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new editor, resizing table columns with merged cells doesn’t work and they reset to actual/preset width.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with multiple rows and columns.
 # Merge two cells(vertically) in the first column.
 # Resize the first column, click on the second column and the first column width resets.

h3. Expected Results

Resizing the columns should work
h3. Actual Results

Columns reset to the actual width and don’t hold the changes made.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table column can't be accurately moved, when table cells are merged

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you export a site/space to XML, Audit log entries of the export will show Anonymous instead of the user who performs the export. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a site/space to XML
# Check Audit log entries

h3. Expected Results
* Audit log entries of site/space export should show the person who performs the export. 

h3. Actual Results
* Audit log entries of site/space export is showing Anonymous
 
h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Site/Space Export logged as Anonymous in the Audit log

fields.description:
{panel:title= Note|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
Unfortunately, the markup macro in the old editor no longer works as expected.
 The modal window won't show up to you even in a newly created page once you faced this bug in other pages unless you clear browser cache.

The product team encourages you to switch to [the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], especially if you are keen to specify style with Markdown.
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot add more than one Markup Macro in TinyMCE Editor Pages
h3. Environment

Pages created with the TinyMCE Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * In a fresh browser (Cache & Cookies Cleared)
 * Edit a page
 * Go to Insert More Content -> Markup
 * Choose Markdown, past some markdown, insert
 * Go to Insert More Content -> Markup (a second time)
 * -> Nothing happens

h3. Expected Results

The Panel to Add Markup/Markdown text should pop up
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens but the following error can be seen in the dev tools log.
{noformat}
Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token M in JSON at position 0
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at Object.get 
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot add more than one Markup Macro in TinyMCE Editor Pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users cannot edit the roadmap macro when they click on the pencil icon in fabric editor

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Fabric Editor
* Firefox
* Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on the COnfluence instance with the new editor.
# Embed Roadmap planner macro on this page using */roadmap* shortcut or using the macro browser.

h3. Expected Results
The roadmap macro should be editable when clicking on the pencil icon

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when we click on the pencil icon to edit the roadmap macro.
 
h3. Notes
Sometimes when we add the roadmap planner macro, it is editable for the first time but becomes uneditable after publishing the page and re-editing it.

h3. Workaround
As of now, there is no workaround in my knowledge but it will be added if we find one.
fields.summary: Cannot edit the roadmap planner macro, the pencil button to edit doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images aspect ratios that cannot easily be fitted into a single Word Document page appear blurred when exported to Word.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an image with a height and width that don't easily scale to a Word Page
 # Export page to Word.

h3. Pages Render properly
h3. Images are blurred severely.

h3. Workaround

Export to PDF does not suffer the same issue.
fields.summary: Images with certain aspect ratios appear blurred when exported to Word

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a page, users cannot publish a pasted image from clipboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to copy a small image with snipping tool
# Edit the page and paste the image.
# Click on Publish

h3. Expected Results
The image should be displayed on the published page.

h3. Actual Results
If the image small, you'll be able to publish, but you'll see a "broken image" on the view page.

h3. Workaround
Use another browser
fields.summary: Cannot paste image from clipboard fails in Interner Explorer 11
Users should be able to customize the Panel Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence JIRA Chart macro, incorrect data is shown when comparing the data shown in Jira dashboard
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter in JIRA to include issues that have hidden fields and returns some issues across multiple projects.
 # In one of the projects have a custom field (For example, TEST CUSTOM FIELD) in another project don't have such custom field.
 # Use a filter to show piechart on Jira dashboard configured by custom field.
 # Use the same filter to show piechart in CONFLUENCE and we will notice that the number of issues that are irrelevant in the pie chart as have an equal number of issues displaying their default value NONE

h3. Expected Results

Confluence JIRA Chart macro should show the same data as Jira dashboard chart when the same filter is used.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence JIRA Chart macro shows more number of issues than the Jira dashboard
h3. Notes

Any field that is usually hidden in the Jira issue view is rendered as irrelevant in the Jira pie chart when that particular field is used for as the statistic type (primary display value) for the pie chart.
However, when this data is being rendered via JIRA issue macro in confluence, the confluence is taking the issues that are irrelevant and also including its default value (in our case it's NONE) which is causing the number to issues that are irrelevant in the pie chart to also display their default value.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to unhide/show the hidden field in field configuration scheme.
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA Chart macro shows incorrect data compared to the Jira pie chart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editor, on a tables set to wide, if the columns are resized, there will be a scrollbar even if there's no content on the cells.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Insert a 3-column table
# Set the table to "Wide" mode by clicking two times on the Wide arrows
# Resize the columns by making the 1st and 3rd columns narrower.
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
No scrollbar should be shown

h3. Actual Results
There's a scrollbar even if there's no content on the table:
|  !scrollbar.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Workaround
Setting the table to "Centre" mode will remove the scrollbar, (the workaround doesn't apply when the page is already in the Full Width mode)
fields.summary: Tables in new editor in Wide mode have a horizontal scrollbar

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to *switch between* the new editing experience (*narrow view*) and the old one (*wider view*)
h3. Why this is important

Documentation may not fit on the new page style, for both editing or viewing. Working can become cumbersome. Wasted space on higher resolution monitors (1080p, 4k).
fields.summary: Choose Between Editor View Style

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Fabric editor it’s now possible to embed a video to a Confluence page, however, the embedded video is like the size of a thumbnail and there’s no way to resize it. 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a video (mp4) to a page
# In Edit mode the video looks like a full page, however, when it gets saved it's the size of a thumbnail

h3. Expected Results
here should be a way to resize the embedded video

h3. Actual Results
Not possible to resize the embedded video in Confluence

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Not possible to resize the embedded video in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the introduction of the Fabric Editor, it is no longer possible to use the arrow keys to select among existing labels when adding labels through the Labels popup.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open page
# Hit 'l' to open Labels popup
# Start typing the name of an existing label

h3. Expected Results
Possibility to use arrow keys (or other keyboard shortcuts) to select an existing label from a dropdown list.

h3. Actual Results
Not possible to use arrow keys or any other keyboard shortcut to select an existing label from a dropdown list

h3. Workaround
Use the mouse
fields.summary: No longer possible to use arrow keys to select among existing labels in Labels popup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A page containing a table in the old editor is exported and imported to a new site which is using the fabric editor, the table is scrollable after the first edit of the page. This also happens for the tables present inside page property macros.
h3. Environment


*Confluence Cloud
*Fabric Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table on the old editor with long text. (In the published mode, the table is not scrollable)
 # Export this page and import it to another site which uses fabric editor.
 # The table looks fine until the page is edited.
 # On publishing the page after an edit, the table becomes scrollable.

h3. Expected Results

Table rows content is displayed on the page without needing to scroll it
h3. Actual Results

Table rows are scrollable.
h3. Workaround

Need to edit the page and manually drag the rows for the desired width and then click on the * center* sign on the top right of the table.
fields.summary: Importing a page to new editor makes the table scrollable after edit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the introduction of the Fabric Editor the settings for the macro 'Content by Label' are no longer respected. The preview will correctly display configured settings, but editor preview and published page show results with settings ignored. This includes settings like Sort By, Show Labels for Each Page and Show Space Name for Each Space. 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in Fabric Editor
# Add macro 'Content by Label'
# Edit settings for macro, setting sort type, and uncheck Show Labels for Each Page and Show Space Name for Each Page 
# Click Preview and confirm the configured settings
# Save macro settings
# In the editor the macro is displayed with none of the settings in effect 
# Publishing the page will show that configured settings are not applied

h3. Expected Result
The edited settings are saved and the macro content is displayed as shown in preview.

h3. Actual Results
Settings are not saved.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Settings for 'Content by Label' macro are ignored/not saved

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Link text on links pointing to target pages in the same Confluence Cloud instance are no longer automatically updated when the target page's title is changed. 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page (source page) in the new Fabric Editor
# Add a link to another page on the same Confluence Cloud instance (/hyperlink)
# A link to the target page is created, and the link text is set to the target page's title
# Save the source page
# Edit the target page, change its title and save
# Go back to the source page

h3. Expected Results
* The link text in the source page should now automatically have been updated to the new title of the target page, and the actual link should still point correctly to the target page.

h3. Actual Results
The link text in the source page is not updated, it still displays the original link text (old title of target page).
The actual link is likewise not updated, but when the users click the link he is redirected to the target page with an updated title.

h3. Workaround
- Manually update the links
fields.summary: Links to pages on same Confluence Cloud instance not updated when target page's title changes
"Roadmap Planner" Macro Formatting Customization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Excerpt/ Include Excerpt include macro fails on Fabric Editor
h3. Environment
Fabric Editor Pages


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Excerpt Macro on Page A
 # Put Include Excerpt Macro on Page B and reference the macro on Page A

h3. Expected Results
Content is Added
h3. Actual Results
Instead of the excerpt, you get "unsupported content"


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excerpt/ Include Excerpt include macro fails on Fabric Editor

fields.description:
In Confluence Cloud, the number of available syntax options cannot be modified.

It would be helpful if lesser used languages, such as Cucumber/Gherkin could be added to the supported syntax list.
fields.summary: Add Code Block Macro syntax support for Cucumber/Gherkin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an attachment is opened in Confluence attachment preview, selecting an older version of the attachment and opening with Edit with option shows the latest/recent version of attachment and not the older version selected.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Confluence page, add an attachment (for example an excel sheet)
 # Edit the attachment and upload so that there are multiple versions of the attachment.
 # Now navigate to the page and open the attachment.
 # In attachment preview, from the available list of versions select an older version.
 # Now click on Edit with and open the attachment (for example, Edit with - Numbers, Edit with - Excel)
 # The latest/current version of attachment will be opened and not the older version selected.

h3. Expected Results

The older/selected version of attachment should be opened.
h3. Actual Results

The latest/current version of attachment is opened.

 
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to download the older version of the attachment, edit and upload.
fields.summary: In confluence attachment preview, selecting and opening an older version of attachment with 'Edit with' shows the latest/recent version

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 17 December 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi all!

My name’s Paul and I’m an engineer for the Confluence Cloud Editor. I’ve been feature leading a stream of work to bring image linking functionality back to the editor in Confluence Cloud. I’m super excited to let you know that it’s now been rolled out to 100% of customers!

Note: some customers have asked for a slower rollout. If you don’t have it on your instance yet, this is likely why. Hold tight, you’ll receive it in the coming weeks!

To add a link to an image, simply select an image in the editor -> click on the link icon in the floating toolbar -> type in your link or use the in-product search dropdown that appears -> press enter to confirm. Voila! You’ve added a link to your image.

We hope you love it as much as we do.

Thanks for your feedback. I’m going to close this ticket out now as done.

Cheers,
Paul | Feature Lead, Atlassian Cloud Editor{panel}
With the new Fabric Editor, it is no longer possible to add a link to an image, making the image clickable to open link address. This was standard functionality in the old editor.
h3. Environment

Fabric Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Fabric Editor
 # Add an image to your new page
 # Click on the page in edit mode
 # The link icon in the menu is now greyed out

h3. Expected Results

When I click on the image in the Fabric Editor I expect to be able to click on the link icon in the menu, to add a link.
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to add link to an image. When you click the image in the Fabric Editor the link icon in the menu is greyed out.

Workaround
 Use an add-on like draw.io or Gliffy to import an image and add link to a transparent box covering the image.
fields.summary: Cannot add link to image in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
After migrating from on-premise to Cloud, large images doesn't render properly in pages on Cloud.
 
{noformat}
This image is too large to apply effects. Please make it smaller (less than 4,000,000px in total dimensions) and try again.
{noformat}


h3. Workaround:
- Run below SQL on the on-premise to get all the pages in which there are large images which has effects enabled on them.
{noformat}
select 
	spaces.spacename, parent_content.title AS "Page Title", content.title AS "Image Title",
        i.height, i.width, i.height * i.width AS "Pixels Size",
       ROUND(contentproperties.longval/1024/1024, 2) AS "file_size (MB)"
from 
	content 
	inner join contentproperties on content.contentid = contentproperties.contentid
	inner join content parent_content on content.pageid = parent_content.contentid
	inner join spaces on content.spaceid = spaces.spaceid
	inner join bodycontent on content.pageid = bodycontent.contentid
        inner join imagedetails i on content.contentid = i.attachmentid
where 
	content.contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT'
	and contentproperties.propertyname = 'FILESIZE'
	and parent_content.content_status = 'current'
	and content.prevver is NULL
	and bodycontent.body like '%ac:image ac:queryparams="effects=%'
	and contentproperties.contentid in (select contentproperties.contentid from contentproperties where stringval like 'image%')
        and i.height * i.width >= 4000000
order by contentproperties.longval desc;
{noformat}
- After the migration, go to Cloud instance, and open the page in edit mode, click on the broken image in edit mode and choose "Properties" then remove the effect (change it to none instead of having a border).
fields.summary: Images are broken and not displaying correctly on Cloud instance after migrating from on-premise

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When in Jira, in the old issue view, you add a link to a Confluence page, the *Jira links* button on the top of the Confluence page is either not created or not updated (depending whether it was already there or not).

h3. Environment
Newly created instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a new instance, in Jira, disable the new issue view and then create a new issue in a classic scrum project.
# In Confluence, Create a new page (e.g. in your personal space).
# Link the new issue with the new page from the Jira (old issue view: issue links -> link to Confluence page).

*Expected Results*
The Confluence shows the "Jira link" button on top of the page pointing to the url of the Jira issue.
 
*Actual Results*
In Jira, you see that the issue is linked to the Confluence page, but on the Confluence page, there is no "Jira link" button on top of the page pointing to the Jira issue.


h3. Workaround

Add the Jira link to the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Jira links button on the top of the Confluence page is either not created or not updated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is no longer possible to create "undefined page link" in Confluence Cloud, since the introduction of the new Fabric Editor.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new or edit page in fabric Editor
# Insert Hyperlink (/hyperlink)
#  Type name of new Confluence page you want to create (undefined page)
# Save page

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the link to undefined page creates the new page with link title and opens Fabric Editor and user can start entering contents to new page.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the link brings up a blank page (about:blank).

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Cannot create "undefined page link" in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
Hi i want to try to renew the lizense but getting belo

 

!image-2019-02-15-16-47-23-701.png!

we are currently using clustering and this are given to us. may i know how i can proceed with this? we currently moving from unlimited to us 20k users license.
fields.summary: try to renew license but getting invalid cluster

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a Jira issues macro that lists a high number of issues (50+) inside a table will cause performance issues on the PDF export of the page.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a Jira Issue macro on a page and insert a JQL that will return 50 ~ 100 issues
# Put the macro inside a 1x1 table
# Publish the page
# Export it to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The page export should take the same time as when the macro is outside of the table

h3. Actual Results
The export can take 50x more:
| !pdf_export_perf.png|thumbnail! |


h3. Notes
* The page that had the Jira macro *outside* the table exported within a minute. The same page but with the Jira macro *inside* a table took more than 50 minutes.
* If there're more Jira macros, it can take longer.

h3. Workaround
Remove the Jira issues macro from inside of the table.
fields.summary: PDF export of a page with a Jira Macro inside a table takes hours to complete

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page Properties Report intermittently failing with a "Error while fetching page properties report data" error message in Confluence pages.

h3. Environment
* Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Page Properties Report macro to a page;
# Select the content that needs to be displayed from Page Properties Macros;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* The macro loads the content as expected.

h3. Actual Results
*  !Screen Shot 2019-02-14 at 19.01.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Refresh the page until the macro displays the macro content.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report intermittently failing with an "Error while fetching page properties report data" error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when the user edit/publishes a page, the same will be displayed under the "*Recently worked on*" tab that is under the *My work* option on the sidebar. However, if a different user updates a page that you have worked previously (like a month ago, and then, someone else works on it), this page will come to the top, as if this was the last edited/work from the user, which can cause confusion for users that are relying on the list of content that is being worked. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a page in Confluence
# Go to the dashboard and under the *My work* option, confirm that the recently worked page is indeed, displayed there.
# Create/work on different pages, so they will be on the top of the *recently worked on* list
# Have a different user updating the first page that has been worked, which should no longer be on the top of the list

h3. Expected Results
The page list should be only updated for the user that did the update.

h3. Actual Results
The page goes for the top of the list for all the users that have previously worked on the page, as if this has been a recent edit made by them.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Recently worked on" pages change the order if other user updates a page

fields.description:
Whenever a page is created using the Meeting Notes template, they are created under the Meeting Notes index page even if a different parent is selected.

 

The pages should be created under whatever parent page is selected by the user.

As of now we can use drag and drop to move the pages to respective parent.
fields.summary: Meeting notes to be saved under selected parent page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Connect app UI elements with the addon_property_contains_any_user_group, space_property_contains_any_user_group or content_property_contains_any_user_group conditions fail to display.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Connect app providing a UI element using one of the broken conditions.
# Navigate to the appropriate place in the UI.

h3. Expected Results

The condition is evaluated and returns true or false.

h3. Actual Results

The condition is evaluated and always returns false.

h3. Workaround

Apps can work around the failure by temporarily removing the condition from their app descriptors.
fields.summary: Connect *_contains_any_user_group conditions always return false

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attachments like Office files or PDFs have been attached to a page, the user can click on these files to have a preview of the file contents load in the browser. The first time a user opens such a preview it will take Confluence a few seconds to display the preview. The text "Your preview is on its way\!" is displayed at this time. Generating this first preview typically took a few seconds at most, on Confluence Cloud before the introduction of the Fabric Editor. Now it takes between minutes and "forever" to generate a preview.\\ \\ 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Fabric Editor and add at least one attachment (drag and drop to page)
# Save the page and open in view mode
# Click on the attached file to open preview
# Wait...

h3. Expected Results
A preview of the attached file is displayed in the browser window

h3. Actual Results
The progress indicator spins forever, or at best it takes x minutes for the preview to load. Most users will have given up long before it loads.

h3. Workaround
- Restarting the browser will fix the problem (Chrome and Mozilla Firefox)
fields.summary: In browser preview of uploaded attachments broken with Fabric Editor
